Check out our unique perks. All donors are kept up to date on the project, and we have various levels of goodies to say thanks for your support.


Other Ways You Can Help
Join us on Twitter @ApocalypsEV1
Check out the website http://ApocalypsEV.com


Please share the project with people who might be interested

Cheers,
Michael and Kenny

story:
PBS Video:  Silence Of The Bees

 

It's A Lot Like The X-Files:

Honey Bees are dying in their Billions all over the world and It isn't just the Bees, it's ALL of the species of pollinator insects.  We may be witnessing the onset of a true extinction level event. If the pollinators die out, so do we.

We will begin by deploying 200 completely New and healthy Bee Hives throughout the foothills of the Northern Arizona mountain ranges, in order to replenish the "wild" bee population. New technologies to trap and kill predatory mites, beetles and moths will be integrated into each new hive.

We will use the new, pathogen resistant Queen Bees from BeeWeaver Genetics along with Mite resistant Russian Bees to produce both primary and daughter colonies that have been bred to maximize their resistance to Varoa Mites and the viruses that attack and destroy Bee colonies. 

We will also build a number of experimental hives that utilize wax cell foundations and starter feeders incorporating colloidal silver in an experimental attempt to deactivate viruses and bacterial pathogens within the hive and within the Bees that live in it.

Approximately 200 New Hives will be distributed to small family owned  farms and orchards throughout Northern Arizona in order to bolster their food production capacity and help to ensure the success of their food crops.

We'll keep on keepin on:

Utilizing economies of scale (big single purchases) we can keep the single-hive deployment costs to approximately $500 a hive.

Should we exceed our funding goals, we will be able to instrument many of the new hives, collecting real-time data on the health, survival, population growth and honey production of each one.

That data will be sent to the "Global Hive" for distribution to the various Honey Bee Research and Genome Projects world wide.

If we fail to reach our goal, we will deploy as many new hives as our achieved level of funding allows.

Projected Impact Of The Bee Hive Project:

I have a quirky tendency to be a bit too serious about these things at times but THE SITUATION IS ENTIRELY CRITICAL ... and if you think our duplicitous, power hungry, money grubbing politicians are going to tell us the Truth about it, you have another think comming.  Already, the people who stand to make or lose money on each end of the spectrum are attempting to obfuscate and confuse the issue in a battle of PR wars ... some claiming the problem is solved, some blaming the insecticide companies and others blaming the governments. They will all still be running around in circles while the population is starving in the streets.  All of this is taking place in much the same way as the criminal miss management of the financial and housing markets that have left millions of us without homes.

Governments don't solve problems ... People Do!!!

There are many things in our country and in our Government that none of us can do anything about right now ... But this isn't one of them.   If we do nothing and the pollinators die out, We will be starving along with our children and just about everyone else in only a few years.  In the mean time, the cost of fruits, vegetables, sugar, coffee and nearly everything else will rise exponentially.  It will cost as much to buy a pound of sugar as it currently costs to fill your gas tank .... And That's Not Bullshit.

If we Are successful we can make a really serious contribution toward:

1. The long term survival of a Legion of Pollinator insects.

2. The survival of healthy "wild" Bee populations.

3. The economic survival of family farms & orchards.

4. The successful continuation of our national food supply.

To say nothing of saving approximately 15,600 farms and the 32,000 jobs that would otherwise be lost in the collapse of our 26 million acre agricultural community. 

Other Ways You Can Help if you're Monitarily challenged:

Local contributions of related material and equipment would help a LOT.

We could certainly use another short flat bed truck and a couple of Sea containers.

A few Acres of land North of Phoenix for assembling and staging hives would put us a lot closer to the deployment areas.

Your ideas and suggestions would also be greatly appreciated.

 

So Please pass this on to your friends on Twitter, Facebook and any of the other social networks you might be a member of.

ALSO:

If you don't see the value in being able to EAT REAL FOOD a few years from now, and can't help our campaign ... Perhaps you can see the value in helping someone else:

You could always pledge a few bucks to

This One:

http://www.indiegogo.com/4Igor?a=1277969

Or This One:

http://www.indiegogo.com/SaveIrene?a=1277969

Or Maybe This One:

http://www.indiegogo.com/jogging-for-jack?a=1277969

 I don't know any of them but they don't seem to be doing as well as they might be if they were fashionable, hot chicks, designing a new game, making a new film or trying to build a new Tesla Museum.... Hmmmm

story:
Our Story

We are the Friends of the Ontario Ranger Program.

The Ontario Ranger Program (ORP), formerly the Ontario Junior Ranger Program, was founded in 1944 and provided an opportunity for young workers to gain first-hand knowledge of resource management through a work and learning experience. More than 70,000 Ontario youth have participated in the 70-year old program.

In September 2012 the Liberal government - without prior public consultation - cancelled the program and shut down all 13 camps across the province. Now, Premier Kathleen Wynne’s government has committed $295 million dollars in the 2013 provincial budget for youth employment. Restoration of the Ontario Ranger Program fits the employment mandate for young people.

The Friends of the Ontario Ranger Program (FORP) is a group that aims to empower young people of Ontario to advocate for the full restoration of the Ontario Ranger Program. The goal is to demonstrate to all Ontarians that the Ontario Ranger Program is an integral part of the Ontario Public Service. FORP aims to find a positive and effective way to restore the program so the integrity and spirit of the Ontario Ranger Program can continue for future generations. Our objective are simple:

The FORP want to:

 • Build awareness that the program has been discontinued

 • Demonstrate by example the importance of Ontario Rangers Program

 • Convince Premier Kathleen Wynne and the Minister of Natural Resources, David Orazietti to reinstate the program.

 What We Need & What You Get

In an effort to promote our campaign and to raise awareness, the FORP are hosting a weekend Jamboree Reunion in Huntsville, ON on August 24, 2013.

This Jamboree will include speeches from Ranger Alumni and a celebrity guest, ranger memorabilia and The Friends of the Ontario Ranger Program (FORP) have volunteered to build an education trail.The trail is part of the Waterloo Summit Centre for the Environment and will feature minimum edge effects and minimum habitat fragmentation so the various types of wildlife will use this area as their home. The trail will connect the local community more to their natural environment.

The trail building will be an example of the kind of work being lost with the cancellation of the Ontario Ranger Program.

For further details about the eco-trail building event check out: www.savetherangers.ca

Your generous donations will go towards funding all aspects of the event including, but not limited to: facility rental fees, advertising and promotional costs, and beyond the Jamboree to help move this campaign forward as we will continue to fight for this incredible program.

The Impact

The impact of your donations will be seen and felt in many different ways. Our main goal is to have the Ontario Ranger Program reinstated, to bring back this incredible opportunity to another 70,000 youth, and then another 70,000 more after that.

Your donation will help the FORP to keep this campaign going and growing by continuing advertising and promoting via the internet, social media and paper media and more awareness events like the Huntsville Jamboree Reunion.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many other ways you can help us win this fight should you not be able to contribute a financial donation. We encourage everyone to spread the word, write letters to your local MPP's and Premeir Wynne with your reasons why the Ontario Ranger Program needs to be reinstated. For information and contact information, please visit our website:

www.savetherangers.ca

story:
Now first things first: what is KOMBUCHA? "Immortality Tea" sounds quite ambitious but that is what our ancestors used to call it more than 2000 years ago.

lso named “Miracle Tea” & “Elixir of Long Life” suggestive of its curative & energising nature, Kombucha Tea is a fermented drink made from sweetened tea that combines sweet & sour in one refreshing mouthful.

With years of experiments, we have mastered the recipe and combined our ancestors’ knowledge with 21st century influences to create this new healthy soft drink that tastes AWESOME and that is absolutely full of goodness. A fresh modern way of enjoying the zillion benefits of Kombucha Tea!

 

 

 THE CONSERVATION AND HUMANITARIAN PROJECT

OUR DESTINATION

Setting up bamboo aquaponic systems in South America

 

 

Bamboo is one of the fastest-growing plants on Earth. With the help of a team of experts in permaculture, we intend to utilize this living tool to help construct a tremendous conservation project that will affect  positively the lives of many people and countless species of animals, insects and plants.

By using bamboo as a network for giant aqua hydroponic systems, we will equip farmers and other permaculture enthusiasts with the tools and knowledge needed to grow an abundance of sustainable farmed fruits vegetables and grains for them and their family. This system requires little maintenance, is available for low cost and is environmentally friendly.

BAMBOO AQUAPONIC SYSTEMS

 

                        


Please check our offers for the contributions!

Get involved and lend a helping hand to bringing this world into the kind of place we can not only survive but can THRIVE in!

                    


     

         

Other Ways You Can lend a hand

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

                                  

                                            

                                                       Flower of Life LTD

Special thanks to

Chris Butler, video editor

Jarrett Rickman, BMX dude

Jacob Jones and Matt Kaye, professional skateboarders

For people interested in the bamboo decks

story:
We’re asking for your help with a local campaign to convince the Gates Foundation, and other institutions in Seattle, to divest from fossil fuel companies, and invest in a better future for us all


The Campaign


Seattle is literally a crossroads for the fossil fuel industry. Coal trains, oil trains, Shell’s Arctic drilling fleet: They are all here – and we’ve been fighting them all. But even here in progressive Seattle, the corporate power of oil and coal companies puts us at a disadvantage. 

We have the people power, but they have the money and political power. But can you imagine a world where oil companies no longer have that power?

Well, what if we could take that away from them? 


What if individuals, companies, churches, pension funds, governments united to say that most of our remaining fossil fuels need to stay in the ground.  To say that this isn’t okay anymore: That we simply won’t support companies that want to destroy the climate any longer.

Well, that is possible. And it starts by saying we won’t invest in those companies, and we will not profit from the damage they cause.

That’s the fossil fuel divestment movement – launched right here in Seattle by Bill McKibben.  It’s the fastest growing divestment movement in history, with some 400 social good institutions and over 700 individuals  representing a total of $1 trillion having already divested from fossil fuels.

And now – with the United Nation’s climate talks coming up in Paris later this year – we want to help take the divestment movement to the next level.  We want to take Seattle’s activist energy to ask the world’s largest, most influential foundation, the Gates Foundation, to divest from fossil fuels. 

Imagine the signal that it will send when powerful and influential people – people like Bill Gates – reject fossil fuel companies.

And it’s not just the Gates Foundation. We’re going to build a coalition right here in Seattle of powerful people and institutions ready to divest – to send a message to the Gates Foundation and the world, that we are ready for a different future, and prepared to put our money where our values are.

Students rally outside the University of Washington, Feb 2015. Two months later the University pledged to divest from coal. 


So here's the ask:


350 Seattle has already demonstrated ability, passion and media savvy with Kayaktivism against Shell Oil, protests against oil trains, and rallies against coal. But we’ve been doing it all on volunteer power alone.  With your help we can take this campaign to the next level. With your contribution, we can invest in more organizing, more coalition building, more media, more outside expertise – all the tools required to build a successful campaign.

We love doing what we do - we live for it.  Which is why your support matters so much.  Every dollar you give us leverages so much passion and energy from committed people. It’s an awesome investment in the future you want to see.

We believe that local action can have global impact. That one person acting can inspire others.  That we can take actions in our community that can help create the world we believe in.

Join us. Not everybody can organize, rally or protest, but with your help, we have tons of people ready to mobilize! 

Divestment Rally, Harvard University, April 2015


What Exactly Are We Going To do?


Several months ago The Guardian newspaper launched a campaign calling on the Gates Foundation to divest from fossil fuels. Their petition, now signed by nearly 250,000 people, states: “The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation has made a huge contribution to human progress (. . .) yet their investments in fossil fuels are putting much of that progress at risk. It is morally and financially misguided to invest in companies dedicated to finding and burning more oil, gas and coal."


The Guardian's Video Message to Bill Gates 

And here in Seattle we are dedicated to providing a strong and coherent local voice that will complement The Guardian's worldwide petition.

350 Seattle activists have already spent countless hours building a movement behind this issue. Already 32 Seattle-based organizations have endorsed their call to the Gates Foundation – groups including several churches, the Seattle chapters of The Sierra Club and The Audubon Society and prominent local groups such as Got Green and Backbone Campaign.

 “Between 2030 and 2050, climate change is expected to cause approximately 250,000 additional deaths per year from malnutrition, malaria, and heat stress”  World Health Organization


Moving forward, the campaign is planning to dedicate many hours to coalescing a groundswell of grassroots activism within Seattle in order to engage the Gates Foundation – and other leaders and institutions – on the topics of climate change and fossil fuel divestment. 

Over the course of the campaign we shall hold numerous divestment seminars around the city, organize several large rallies, mobilize a wide base of volunteers so that we are able to carry out daily leafletting outside of the Gates Foundation, execute a worldwide social media event, run a weekly blog and monthly campaign podcasts. Furthermore, using already existing global divestment networks, on the day of our final rally and petition delivery to the Gates Foundation the campaign will organize dozens – or even hundreds – of rallies and events around the world, coordinated to show their support for the Gates Foundation’s divestment from fossil fuels.

It is hoped that by building this sort of movement we will be able to get Bill Gates, one of the world’s richest and most influential men, to send an incredibly powerful message to the world and reject the fossil fuel industry in the most unequivocal of terms - by joining the fossil fuel divestment movement.

We’re asking for your help with a local campaign to convince
the Gates Foundation, and other institutions in Seattle, to divest from fossil
fuel companies, and invest in a better future for us all

The Campaign 
Seattle is literally
a crossroads for the fossil fuel industry. Coal trains, oil trains, Shell’s
Arctic drilling fleet: They are all here – and we’ve been fighting them all. But
even here in progressive Seattle, the corporate power of oil and coal companies
puts us at a disadvantage.  

We have the people power, but they have the money and political
power. But can you imagine a
world where oil companies no longer have that power?Well, what if we could take that away from them? 


What if individuals, companies, churches, pension funds, governments united to
say that most of our remaining fossil fuels need to stay in the ground.  To say that this isn’t okay anymore: That we simply won’t
support companies that want to destroy the climate any longer.
Well, that is possible.
And it starts by saying we won’t invest in those companies, and we will not
profit from the damage they cause.
That’s the fossil
fuel divestment movement – launched right here in Seattle by Bill McKibben.  It’s the fastest growing divestment movement
in history, with some 400 social good institutions and over 700 individuals  representing a total of $1 trillion having already divested from fossil fuels. 
And now – with the
United Nation’s climate talks coming up in Paris later this year – we want to
help take the divestment movement to the next level.  We want to take Seattle’s activist energy to
ask the world’s largest, most influential foundation, the Gates Foundation, to divest from fossil
fuels.  
Imagine the signal
that it will send when powerful and influential people – people like Bill Gates
– reject fossil fuel companies.
And it’s not just the
Gates Foundation. We’re going to build a coalition right here in Seattle of powerful
people and institutions ready to divest – to send a message to the Gates
Foundation and the world, that we are ready for a different future, and
prepared to put our money where our values are.

story:
Did you miss your chance to donate? Just choose your Perk (on the right side of this page) and donation amount!  Because we met our first fundraising goal in June, Indiegogo will allow us to continue accepting donations on this page to help support ongoing construction and operational costs at the frog rescue facility. Feel free to contact us at info@frogrescue.com any time you like! Thank you for caring about our froggy friends! 

Would you like to receive our project updates? Visit our site FrogRescue.com and sign up at the bottom of the page.


Help Save Frogs in Honduras!

Hello, and thank you for visiting our page! My name is Jonathan and I'm a National Geographic Explorer and PhD candidate at James Cook University.  My frog rescue team is racing to save species from extinction.  We need your help to finish building the Honduras Amphibian Rescue & Conservation Center to get this program hopping!

In Honduras, three species of endangered frogs in Cusuco National Park are slipping towards extinction caused by a deadly pathogen called amphibian chytrid fungus.  This pathogen is spreading around the world, but unfortunately the amazing amphibians of Honduras have received little conservation attention.  Now, the frogs need our help!

The three frogs we're racing to save are pictured below.  They are: 1) the Cusuco spike-thumb frog (Plectrohyla dasypus), 2) the Exquisite spike-thumb frog (Plectrohyla exquisita), and 3) the Mossy red-eyed frog (Duellmanohyla soralia).

  


Why Save the Frogs?

Protecting these beautiful frogs is important for many reasons. For example:

  • Frog tadpoles act as “river lawn mowers” and protect clean drinking water.  Many tadpoles eat algae and other plant material which keeps rivers clean, impacting hundreds of thousands of people living nearby.
  • Frogs can also help control the spread of human diseases transmitted by mosquitoes such as malaria, dengue, and Zika. The tadpoles of some frogs are carnivorous and kill mosquito eggs and larvae. Globally, hundreds of millions of people are infected by a mosquito borne illness each year resulting in over one million deaths.
  • Frogs are an important food source for many other animals.  A diversity of fish, birds, snakes, mammals, and insects prey upon frogs and would have a difficult time finding enough food to eat if they disappeared.
  • Amphibians are beautiful creatures that play a role in many cultures and help inspire children to become interested in protecting the natural world.


Rescue Site: Cusuco National Park

The three endangered species we're working to protect live in Cusuco National Park, a breathtaking rainforest that sits in the clouds on top of a mountain in Honduras. We have been working here for nearly 10 years, studying these amazing animals in the wild.

 

Cusuco National Park (Cusuco) is located in the Merendon Mountains of northwestern Honduras.  Cusuco harbors remarkable biodiversity and is ranked among the “top 100 most irreplaceable sites” in the world from an analysis of over 173,000 protected areas.  In Cusuco, there are 14 amphibian species listed as Endangered or Critically Endangered on the IUCN Red List of Threatened Species, with five also endemic to this one location.  For this reason, Cusuco is also recognized as a site of global importance by the Alliance for Zero Extinction.  

More broadly, Cusuco is part of the “Meso-American biodiversity hotspot” and protects a variety of additional threatened and endangered species, including Baird’s tapir (Tapirus bairdii), jaguar (Panthera onca), ocelot (Leopardus pardalis), margay (Leopardus wiedii), jaguarondi (Herpailurus yagouaroundi), Geoffroy’s spider monkey (Ateles geoffroyi), the Golden-cheeked warbler (Setophaga chrysoparia) and resplendent quetzal (Pharomachrus mocinno).  During our frog rescue project, we will help raise global awareness about the need to protect this critically important rainforest for all the incredible wildlife it supports.


How Will We Save The Frogs?

To protect these frogs from extinction, we recently started building the Honduras Amphibian Rescue & Conservation Center (HARCC) at Lancetilla Botanical Gardens in Tela, Honduras.  When completed, HARCC will become the headquarters for our long-term frog rescue program.

Once fully operational, our frog rescue activities will begin with a "head-start" program to keep these three endangered species alive in the wild: we will collect large numbers of baby frogs from the rainforest in Cusuco before they die from chytridiomycosis (the disease caused by chytrid infection), transport them to our biosecure HARCC facility where we can cure their chytrid infection, care for them in this safe environment until they become strong healthy adults with better immune systems, and then reintroduce these healthy adults back into the rainforest.  These adult frogs have greater resistance to disease than their babies, so this head-start approach aims to increase the number of adult frogs breeding in the wild and producing offspring to help offset the high death rate of juveniles.  This conservation method has previously been successful in assuring the survival of a variety wildlife species, but has rarely been applied to help frogs combat chytrid fungus in the wild. 

We believe this method will stabilize and hopefully increase frog populations in Cusuco and reduce the likelihood of extinction.  By repeating this year after year, it will also allow natural selection to continue searching for animals genetically resistant to this disease, and eventually these frogs might be able to develop their own immunity over time.  

At the same time as head-starting, we will also operate a captive breeding program to protect populations for reintroduction if sudden unpredictable extinction occurs (e.g from natural disasters like forest fires or illegal habitat destruction, both of which  we have already observed in Cusuco).

  


What We Need 

We previously raised the funds needed to begin constructing the HARCC rescue facility, but now we need your help to finish the job!

Your contributions will go towards:

  • Frog life-support equipment (air conditioners, water pumps, water sterilizers, veterinary medicine, etc.) needed for our frog rescue laboratory
  • Construction of an insect rearing facility (to produce frog food)
  • Construction of a water tower (to produce frog-safe water)
  • Employment for HARCC staff 
  • Frog rescue activities (disease & population surveys in Cusuco)


Perks for You! 

To show our appreciation for your support, we have some nifty perks for you!  

Some of these include photographs of the endangered species you're helping to save, beautiful hand-painted artwork, and even a rainforest tour to see these amazing frogs in the wild!

***A perk for EVERYONE! Every dollar counts and we truly appreciate each donation! If you make ANY contribution to this campaign, we will publicly thank you on our website at www.FrogRescue.com when this campaign is finished.  Please Note: We fully respect your privacy, so if for any reason you do not want to be listed on our website, just send a quick message to info@FrogRescue.com and we will be happy to oblige!***


The Impact 

The conservation program developed at HARCC will become an increasingly important global response model to help combat amphibian extinction caused by chytrid fungus.  This pathogen continues to spread uncontrolled around the world and chytrid-free habitats are disappearing.  We need to explore potential solutions within this context, and that's exactly what we're trying to accomplish by working to keep these endangered frog species alive in the wild.  The conservation work performed by HARCC will become the first in Honduras, and one of few in the world, to reintroduce large numbers of adult amphibians back into their original chytrid-positive habitat in a major attempt to prevent disease-driven extinction of wild populations.


Risks & Challenges

To minimize risks involved with this project, we previously invested several years of research and planning into this effort to increase the likelihood of long-term success.  We now possess a strong foundation of international partners, involving biologists, amphibian care experts, and government authorities in the USA, Honduras, and the UK. Click HERE to read more about the core HARCC team members.  

Every dollar counts! If we exceed our fundraising goal, additional funds will go towards housing repair costs to fix up an old building where local HARCC staff will live while running frog rescue activities.  This building needs a lot of TLC, but is located in a great spot--just 5 minutes down the road from the HARCC rescue facility.  Additional funds will also be put towards our next big field survey to measure current levels of amphibian pathogens in Cusuco.

Together with your help, we'll finally have the resources we need to start fighting amphibian extinction in Honduras!


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please SHARE this page with all your friends!
  • Follow us on social media! Join us now as this exciting frog rescue mission unfolds.  Like us on facebook, follow us on Twitter, and visit our Website.
  • Tell people it's important to save amphibians (More info here)
  • Talk to us - we'd love your feedback about this project! (info@FrogRescue.com)

Thank you for your support!

Jonathan Kolby
National Geographic Explorer
Director, Honduras Ampibian Rescue & Conservation Center
www.FrogRescue.com

Here are your choices for the Photo Perks listed above:

DUELLMANOHYLA SORALIA

3.    4.  

5.     6.  


PLECTROHYLA DASYPUS

story:
We need your support. For more than two years, Fossil Free Cal--a group of concerned UC Berkeley students, alumni, and community members--has been calling on the University of California Regents to divest their $3 billion endowment from the top 200 fossil fuel companies that are most responsible for creating devastating climate change.

If it's wrong to wreck the climate, it's wrong to profit off that wreckage, which is exactly what the Regents are currently doing. If the University of California, one of the world's leading public institutions, decides to divest, it will send a clear global message that it is no longer acceptable to profit from such a destructive industry. We're fighting to make this historic decision a reality.

Fossil Free Cal has been active over the last three years, with successes on campus passing ballot initiatives and senate bills endorsing fossil fuel divestment with broad student, faculty and staff support. This spring, students across the country are demanding climate justice together by pledging to escalate our movement through concerted nonviolent direct action this spring.

In order to do make our campaign heard, we need financial support. Funding will go to sound systems, flyers, banners, t-shirts, and general expenditures that are necessary to call a community to action. 

We need supporters of Fossil Free Cal to help us make this a reality. Can you contribute towards furthering our movement and our message? Please donate anything you can to support us in divesting from a fossil fuel future and reinvesting in social justice.

story:
What's this all about?

We are a nonprofit called PLACE, known for creating cutting-edge sustainable communities for the arts and economic development. We are building the first sustainable community in the world that is powered by waste. We call it E-Generation, and it's ready to happen next year, but we need your help for the last $250,000! With your donations through Indiegogo, we can put together the funds we need to complete the design. And every donor will be sent a first look at our designs!

The mission of PLACE is to create places that foster a sustainable, just and inspiring world. We’re a young organization, but we’ve got a deep roster of experience on our team and board directors when it comes to developing leading-edge communities that are inclusive, affordable, and sustainable. 

We believe that we need to leapfrog current standards of sustainability when it comes to building new developments, so we are going to create a community that generates more energy than it consumes. We believe that by creating this first model project, cities all over the country will see the potential, and a major impact can be made to wean ourselves off of fossil fuels and gain energy independence. In a nutshell, this is the plan:

Gimme the details!

In conjunction with Hennepin County and the City of St. Louis Park, we will take an old, derelict building – the former McGarvey coffee roastery – and turn it into a facility that processes organic solid waste (food waste) into clean, renewable energy. We’ve developed a system that uses solar, wind, geothermal and anaerobic digestion to very efficiently convert this waste into biogas, which can then be used to generate electricity. The process is silent, odorless, non-intrusive, and is designed to operate in a dense urban environment. 

But that’s only Phase One.

Once the energy facility is up and running, PLACE will develop a cutting edge, transit-oriented community to surround it, all of which will be powered by waste: affordable housing, makers’ space for artists and creatives, commercial space for local businesses, and more. 

We want to show the world that our cities and communities can be developed to be empowering, and truly sustainable. Currently, organic solid waste in Minneapolis is trucked far outside the city, costing us money and fuel, and releasing greenhouse gases. With this project, Hennepin County will save money, and we’ll be putting the waste to work to power homes and businesses in a closed loop: the waste creates energy, which allows community to flourish, which generates more waste, and so on. Let's not let good waste go to waste!

What We Need & What You Get

This is a very ambitious vision, but we've worked hard to put all the pieces in place. Everything is aligned to make it happen by May 2014, but we need $2 million to push us over the top. We don't believe it's realistic for us to raise $2 million through crowd sourcing, so we're going for $250,000 to complete design.

Once E-Generation is up and running, we will have time to do what we do best: plan, design, and fund a new community that will be powered by E-Generation. In other words, we'll build a new sustainable community powered by waste.

For your donation, we offer some great perks which you can see to the right: construction tours, signed architectural plans, dinner with our Executive Director Chris Velasco, naming rights, and more!

Our experience

PLACE specializes in creating partnerships between the public and private, and the for-profit and nonprofit worlds. We have a lot of experience in making complicated projects happen. This project is a major collaboration between these partners:

Our most recent example a community in Ventura, California called WAV (Working Artists Ventura). We developed WAV hand-in-hand with the Ventura community to meet a serious need for affordable housing and artist space, and together, we created something that stands apart: the world’s first sustainable artist community. It’s a huge success, and thriving today. WAV is a vibrant, active community of engaged citizens, formerly homeless families, successful artists, and people of all income levels. The building itself is LEED certified, and includes solar power. It has transformed downtown Ventura. Here's a photo:

We envision this new E-Generation project in St. Louis Park to feature all the best aspects of WAV, and be powered by clean, renewable energy.

The Impact

With your help, we will create something that has the potential to be a true game-changer. If you've never given to charity before, this is the one; to change the lives of hundreds, and to change the way communities view energy and waste (Save the Waste!). 

Imagine communities like this all over the world, designed and built to embrace everything that creates true community: affordable homes and live/work space, art and culture, local businessnes, easy transit access, a lessened dependence on cars, and on-site agriculture: all powered by clean, renewable energy derived from waste.

Together, we can: 

  • Open E-Generation (Phase I) by May
  • Launch the first sustainable community powered by garbage
  • Set the stage for many more projects
  • Create a tax deduction for you
  • Create affordable homes for people, and lower government burden

Thank you!

story:
Thrive For A Purpose

We are a group of University of Tennessee students running a fundraiser for the nonprofit organization Thrive Lonsdale. Thrive Lonsdale is a Christian afterschool, summer, and mentoring program for at-risk children in the Lonsdale area. Our goal is to raise one-thousand dollars for upgraded conditions to playground equipment for kids who reside in Lonsdale. In an area where kids are being tempted and affected by gang violence, drugs, and poverty at a very young age, a playground serves as a safe place/ escape for youth, thus by upgrading the playground one is directly affecting the well-being of these kids and the neighborhood as a whole. Raising funds for the after school program provides the kids with a supportive atmosphere where their spiritual, emotional, academic, and physical needs are met.

     The Christian based program provides Bible studies and small groups to help the kids grow in their faith. These kids come from various backgrounds where all their needs aren't met and they do not get the typical home life that most children do. The non-profit organization takes care of these kids in so many vital ways. Some examples of Thrive’s care for their kids are academic tutoring, emotional support, and even providing meals. With your help, we can provide what is needed for this organization and help change these kid’s lives. By donating you get the chance to make a positive impact on a kid’s life. With your help, we have no doubt that we will reach our goal of raising one-thousand dollars for Thrive. Thank you so much for your time.

story:
Short Summary

Food Shift is an East Bay, California based organization working to reduce wasted food and utilize the abundance of food in our communities to empower, nourish, and engage the community.  Our social enterprise, The Food Shift Kitchen, uses recovered food to employ people and feed the community nutritious food.

After 3 years of piloting our social enterprise in a small shared kitchen, we’re raising $40,000 to move into a larger, centrally-located East Bay kitchen so we can enroll more apprentices in our job training program, recover more food, and expand Food Shift Catering.

 

Why we need you!

We have worked hard to generate revenue through our vegetarian catering company - securing contracts with health, youth, and housing programs and catering events and meal with big companies.  And yet we still depend on community donations.  People like you help us make this dream a reality.  Please join us!

 

Our Model and the Impact

Climate collapse and social inequality are two of the most pressing realities of our time.  Food Shift's model addresses them both.  If food waste were a country, it would be the third largest greenhouse gas emitter behind China and the U.S.  

Food Shift donates 80% of its recovered produce to community partners who feed food insecure populations.  And, we know that food alone won't solve hunger.  Food Shift goes beyond the broken charity model to  educate, empower, and uplift people using the power of food.

 

Every year, 40% of food produced is thrown out or otherwise wasted in the United States.  

 

Chef Suzy and program graduate and now employee, Ms. Debra, work together to prepare food for catering clients.

 

Testimonials

“Food Shift is at the very forefront of exploring the links between food, community, economic empowerment, inclusion and health.” --Robert Egger, Founder of DC Central Kitchen and LA Kitchen

“Food Shift empowered me and gave me the confidence and work experience I needed to get and keep a job. My life is on a steady path now and I am so grateful for Food Shift in helping me get there.”  -- Henrika, Program Graduate

“I’ve learned so much working with Food Shift. I love feeding people, my confidence has increased, and the income helps provide more stability for my family.” - Ms. Debra, Program Graduate

“Food Shift provides us with high quality, fresh produce that is hard to get otherwise.” - Peter Onderwater, Alameda Food Bank 

“Food Shift continues to play a leadership role in food recovery innovation. They’re great partners and friends.”  - Ben Simon, Imperfect Foods, Founder

“Food Shift gives our residents an invaluable kitchen experience that serves as a stepping stone to employment in the food service industry. Along the way, our residents feel challenged to expand their skills and valued for their contribution.” - Michael Radding, Alameda Point Collaborative, Director of Programs 

"I feel successful. I feel like I can go do whatever I want to do.  I have learned a lot and I am stronger, more focused." - Ms. Carolyn, Program Graduate

"I feel that I am making a difference just by working and being a part of Food Shift" - Guiselle Reyna, Program Graduate

 

Chef Jen and Driver Robert sort recovered food; Food Shift regularly picks up excess produce from Imperfect, Good Eggs, and SF Produce Market.  

 

Media Articles and Awards

"Aside from feeding people, reducing waste, and creating job opportunities, Food Shift is also combating climate change by rescuing food — a total of 120,000 pounds a year — that would otherwise contribute to greenhouse gas emissions. A bigger kitchen would also allow Food Shift to recover even more produce, further reducing water consumption and greenhouse gas emissions." 

- East Bay Express, "Food Shift Looks to Raise Funds, Broaden Impact" 

 

“When Mills got out of prison, he was living clean, but still living on the street on and off for 16 months, piecing a living together out of recycling nickel deposit bottles and cans. Until Food Shift, he had not had a steady job in more than 20 years. Produce and people both get a second chance at Food Shift.” 

- Berkeleyside, "Waste not, want more: Food Shift aims to create more jobs and save more food from the trash, but it needs more space"

 

"The organization’s job training program is working to create permanent employment for those impacted by poverty and food insecurity. “While we need charity and emergency food assistance, these models haven’t solved hunger and we have a huge opportunity in this movement to develop and expand solutions that create economic value and invest in the people who have been most systematically oppressed,” explains Frasz to Food Tank.

 - Food Tank, "Food Shift’s Food Waste and Job Training Program Seeks to Grow its Impact"

 

Perks

If you believe in the Food Shift Kitchen and want to give for the sake of giving, please do!  Any amount helps!  To show our gratitude we have some pretty awesome perks lined up for you all, so check them out, show us your love, and please share this campaign with others! 

$10 - Food Shift Stickers: Sport our Food Shift logo on your laptop, bike, water bottle, or anything else to rep your support for our cause! 2 stickers included.

$35 - Food Shift Recipe Booklet: This PDF booklet contains essential Food Shift recipes, tips on reducing waste in the kitchen, and guidance on how to make the best use of leftovers.  Use this recipe booklet to create delicious meals and reduce waste in your own kitchen!

$50 - Food Shift Gift Bag Bundle: Take home a Food Shift Tote bag filled with goodies from Food Shift and other mission-aligned organizations.  The gift bag will include Renewal Mill cookies, ReGrained snack bars, preserves made in the Food Shift Kitchen and local wine!  *We will not be offering shipping on this product - local pickup only. 

$50, $100 - Dec 14th Holiday Party Ticket: This ticket grants you access to Food Shift's holiday party on December 14th with special guest speaker Robert Egger.  There will be food, drinks, and a silent auction with items including Warriors tickets, Patagonia clothes, a dinner with the Founder, and more!  Please view the different tiers to contribute different amounts.

$100 - Co-Sponsor a Day of Food Recovery: Contrary to popular belief, we do not operate on "free" food.  There are many costs that go into recovering food, such as renting a truck, paying a driver, and paying for gas.  By donating $100 you are helping us achieve our annual goal of recovering 120,000 lbs of food by sponsoring a day of food recovery. 

$25 - [Sold Out] Earth Island Journal: Get a year's subscription to the Earth Island Journal to stay up to date on news, analysis, and commentary on vital environmental issues and activism.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends, family, and coworkers about the campaign.
  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and share our posts.
  • Share our video far and wide.

Thank you!

Chef Suzy, Audrey, Jacob, Dana, and Chef Jen - we are so grateful for the incredible community of friends, donors, and partners who make our work possible!

story:
Summary

(www.nicoladaschio.com/ecomobileurope/)

EcomobilEuropE is an initiative aiming to explore the current status of eco-mobility in different European countries and to raise awareness on its environmental, social and economic implications.

to reach these goals I will visit different European cities and countries; I will interview and discuss with eco-mobility experts and policy makers, as well as with cyclists and lay-people; and I will observe and listen to mobility and eco-mobility habits, challenges and opportunities. Overall, I will travel 4500 kilometres around Europe by bike and by train.

During the tour I will record, report and share what I see and what I hear (e.g. pictures, blog, Twitter, Facebook…). I will also compile a report to increase the understanding and raise awareness on the topic. The initiative is open to all ‘eco-mobiles’ who want to follow for few kilometres or on twitter, have a coffee or a drink, couch-surfing, or e-interaction.

The project: what it is about

Ecomobility

Eco-mobility is runningbefore the wind. Vis-à-vis cities which are polluted and polluting, congested and chaotic, European urbanites and policy-makers increasingly look into eco-mobility solutions to improve the quality of life of individuals, communities and the planet.

The concept of eco-mobility refers to a set of traditional and innovative ways of commuting implying a range of environmental, social and economic benefits. Moving toward eco-mobile cities means, for instance, reducing the carbon footprint and the PM content per kilometre travelled. It means moving toward cities where commutes are quick, affordable and pleasant. It means shaping cities and habits that make people really free to choose a way of moving around which is convenient for them and for their whole community.

Throughout Europe and the world, people have adopted different practices, reflecting both the social and physical characteristics of cities. Yet, the road for eco-mobility to become mainstream is still long. As European environmentalist, passionate for cities and urban issues, I want to explore the status of eco-mobility in Europe and raise awareness on the opportunities it carries.

Of course, eco-mobility has to be discovered by bike!


a journey to explore it

On May 1st  I will start the journey. By bike and by train I will visit different European cities to see and experience directly how far eco-mobility has gone. In each one of the cities I will meet policy makers, associations, businness, cyclisysts and students. I will ask them about the chalenges and the opportunities that they see in a more sustainable urban mobility. I will also take with me the messages that these people want to convey further.

The objective is to show the future to people moving in and between cities: there are some many good stories that have improved the quality of life of people, communities and the planet and inspiration is what is needed to replicate them.  There are also some bad stories and big challenges that prevent people to be happy when they move around. From congestion, pollution, road accidents, bike theft: I want to understand why these problems are so difficoult to solve and I want to challenge policy makers with the strength of all the people that will join somehow the trip to find quickly effective solutions.


Partners and supporters

Hardcore eco-mobiles (i.e. individuals and institutions whose work, study or life is particularly connected to eco-mobility issues): This group of people includes professionals, researchers, cyclists, activists, international and local policy makers, bike-producers and retailers, eco-mobility consultants, bike-sharing experts, bus drivers, representatives of associations, bike-coffee managers, etc. … Possibilities to support include endorsing the initiative, being available for interview and discussion, supporting in-kind and in-cash the initiative, increasing the visibility to scale-up the awareness raising potential.

Other eco-mobiles (i.e. those who are interested in eco-mobility and are curious to know and do more about the topic). This group of people virtually include all people who, for reasons related to work, study, love, fun, move around on the road. Everybody is welcome to join the initiative by following me by bike or by train for few kilometres, following my twitter and blog, sharing ideas, a meal or a couch, raising awareness with friends and colleagues on eco-mobility

Who am I 

Myself: Nicola da Schio. In my study and in my work I have always been focusing on the protection of the environment on one hand, and on cities and urban governance on the other. I worked, among others, with UNEP - United Nations Environment Programme -  and with ICLEI - Local Government for Sustainability. I studied the environmental performance of cities, and the governance of the urban commons. I just came back from Addis Ababa where I was working; beforehand I lived in Italy, Germany and France among other countries. As part of this initiative, I will bike, observe, photograph, ask, write, share, etc. …

how can you help me to make it happen

As you can immagine, this campaign needs your support too. With you it can become something much more important  and achieve a bigger impact to make our cities more liveable  and our planet happier.

There are different ways you can help, and,  yes!,  there are very good reasons to chose anyone of them.

#follow me:

You can follow me on twitter (@nicdas13),  on facebook (ecomobileurope), or on the bike!  This will help me especially when I meet policy makers. I will show them that there is a lot of us who want to be happy on the move!

in exchange: I promise I will share very god stories, pctures and songs about EcomobilEuropE. You will also have all the details of your possible future holiday!

#donate or host

This campaign requires passion, training, but also some money or  in kind contribution. I need it mainly to buy bike equipment, or to replace it. I need it for my fuel (food!!) and for the few train tickets I will buy.  I count on the hositality of people along the trip: if you don't have a credit card, but a big couch or an extra chair around your dinner table this is also very welcome (see http://www.nicoladaschio.com/ecomobileurope/ecomobileurope-the-itinerary/ ).

in exchange: check out the 'perks' part. I have a bunch of nice little things for those who can help. From pictures of the trip, to the bike itself I am using!

#share your stories

During the campaign I will share pictures and stories of what I see. You can send me your stories too: I will share them with those who are with me (virtually or physically).

in exchange: some visibility for your stories, some more firends or fans who want to replicate it, some recognition!


the project in detail

Objectives

#1. Explore the current status of eco-mobility in Europe (e.g. understand what is eco-mobility, who are the stakeholders, what are the reasons behind success and failure…);

#2. Raise awareness on the opportunities of eco-mobility (e.g. spread information about successful stories, what are the benefits for urban dwellers and for the planet…)

Outcomes

#1. Detailed report on the status of eco-mobility in Europe, presenting and analysing the status of eco-mobility in selected European countries;

#2. Blog and micro-blog to share ideas and images coming from observation and discussion.


Description of activities

Euro-tour throughout selected cities. The means of transportation include bike, train, public transport, walk… The itinerary runs for ca. 4500 km through different cities in Italy, France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany and Switzerland (the provisional itinerary is annexed).

Meeting and discussion with eco-mobility experts and practitioners. Depending on the availability of the interviewees, discussions might consist of short standard interviews (e.g. what, why, how eco-mobility) and deeper inquiry regarding challenges ad opportunities of eco-mobility solutions (more details on page 3, participants and partners).

Blog and micro-blog reporting the highlights of the tour. All observations and discussions will be regularly recorded and reported online (e.g. nicoladaschio.com/ecomoblog/; @nicdas13; #EcomobilEuropE; Facebook.com/ecomobileurope/)

Analysis of data and final report. A report based on the observations, the interviews and the study of the different realities will be published. The report will include, among other things, data analysis, qualitative case studies, pictures…

 

 budget details


Duration

64 days (April 30th to July 3rd)

Budget

1. Bike

Equipment

250 €

Reparations

250 €

Fuel (food!)

1,000 €

2. Train tickets

(estimated)

500 €

3. Accommodation

 

Couch-surfing / warmshowers.org

2,000 €
story_txt:
Summary
(www.nicoladaschio.com/ecomobileurope/)EcomobilEuropE is an initiative aiming to explore the current status of eco-mobility in different European countries and to raise awareness on its environmental, social and economic implications.
to reach these goals I will visit different European cities and countries; I will interview and discuss with eco-mobility experts and policy makers, as well as with cyclists and lay-people; and I will observe and listen to mobility and eco-mobility habits, challenges and opportunities. Overall, I will travel 4500 kilometres around Europe by bike and by train.
During the tour I will record, report and share what I see and what I hear (e.g. pictures, blog, Twitter, Facebook…). I will also compile a report to increase the understanding and raise awareness on the topic. The initiative is open to all ‘eco-mobiles’ who want to follow for few kilometres or on twitter, have a coffee or a drink, couch-surfing, or e-interaction.The project: what it is about
Ecomobility
Eco-mobility is runningbefore the wind. Vis-à-vis cities which are polluted and polluting, congested and chaotic, European urbanites and policy-makers increasingly look into eco-mobility solutions to improve the quality of life of individuals, communities and the planet.
The concept of eco-mobility refers to a set of traditional and innovative ways of commuting implying a range of environmental, social and economic benefits. Moving toward eco-mobile cities means, for instance, reducing the carbon footprint and the PM content per kilometre travelled. It means moving toward cities where commutes are quick, affordable and pleasant. It means shaping cities and habits that make people really free to choose a way of moving around which is convenient for them and for their whole community.
Throughout Europe and the world, people have adopted different practices, reflecting both the social and physical characteristics of cities. Yet, the road for eco-mobility to become mainstream is still long. As European environmentalist, passionate for cities and urban issues, I want to explore the status of eco-mobility in Europe and raise awareness on the opportunities it carries.
Of course, eco-mobility has to be discovered by bike!a journey to explore it
On May 1st  I will start the journey. By bike and by train I will visit different European cities to see and experience directly how far eco-mobility has gone. In each one of the cities I will meet policy makers, associations, businness, cyclisysts and students. I will ask them about the chalenges and the opportunities that they see in a more sustainable urban mobility. I will also take with me the messages that these people want to convey further.
The objective is to show the future to people moving in and between cities: there are some many good stories that have improved the quality of life of people, communities and the planet and inspiration is what is needed to replicate them.  There are also some bad stories and big challenges that prevent people to be happy when they move around. From congestion, pollution, road accidents, bike theft: I want to understand why these problems are so difficoult to solve and I want to challenge policy makers with the strength of all the people that will join somehow the trip to find quickly effective solutions.
Partners and supporters
Hardcore eco-mobiles (i.e. individuals and institutions whose work, study or life is particularly connected to eco-mobility issues): This group of people includes professionals, researchers, cyclists, activists, international and local policy makers, bike-producers and retailers, eco-mobility consultants, bike-sharing experts, bus drivers, representatives of associations, bike-coffee managers, etc. … Possibilities to support include endorsing the initiative, being available for interview and discussion, supporting in-kind and in-cash the initiative, increasing the visibility to scale-up the awareness raising potential.
Other eco-mobiles (i.e. those who are interested in eco-mobility and are curious to know and do more about the topic). This group of people virtually include all people who, for reasons related to work, study, love, fun, move around on the road. Everybody is welcome to join the initiative by following me by bike or by train for few kilometres, following my twitter and blog, sharing ideas, a meal or a couch, raising awareness with friends and colleagues on eco-mobility
Who am I 

Myself: Nicola da Schio. In my study and in my work I have always been
focusing on the protection of the environment on one hand, and on cities and
urban governance on the other. I worked, among others, with UNEP - United
Nations Environment Programme - 
and with ICLEI - Local Government for Sustainability. I studied the
environmental performance of cities, and the governance of the urban commons. I
just came back from Addis Ababa where I was working; beforehand I lived in
Italy, Germany and France among other countries. As part of this initiative, I
will bike, observe, photograph, ask, write, share, etc. …
how can you help me to make it happen
As you can immagine, this campaign needs your support too. With you it can become something much more important  and achieve a bigger impact to make our cities more liveable  and our planet happier.There are different ways you can help, and,  yes!,  there are very good reasons to chose anyone of them.#follow me:
You can follow me on twitter (@nicdas13),  on facebook (ecomobileurope), or on the bike!  This will help me especially when I meet policy makers. I will show them that there is a lot of us who want to be happy on the move!in exchange: I promise I will share very god stories, pctures and songs about EcomobilEuropE. You will also have all the details of your possible future holiday!#donate or host
This campaign requires passion, training, but also some money or  in kind contribution. I need it mainly to buy bike equipment, or to replace it. I need it for my fuel (food!!) and for the few train tickets I will buy.  I count on the hositality of people along the trip: if you don't have a credit card, but a big couch or an extra chair around your dinner table this is also very welcome (see http://www.nicoladaschio.com/ecomobileurope/ecomobileurope-the-itinerary/ ).in exchange: check out the 'perks' part. I have a bunch of nice little things for those who can help. From pictures of the trip, to the bike itself I am using!#share your stories
During the campaign I will share pictures and stories of what I see. You can send me your stories too: I will share them with those who are with me (virtually or physically).in exchange: some visibility for your stories, some more firends or fans who want to replicate it, some recognition!the project in detail
Objectives

#1. Explore the current status of eco-mobility in Europe (e.g. understand what is eco-mobility, who are the stakeholders, what are the reasons behind success and failure…);
#2. Raise awareness on the opportunities of eco-mobility (e.g. spread information about successful stories, what are the benefits for urban dwellers and for the planet…)
Outcomes

#1. Detailed report on the status of eco-mobility in Europe, presenting and analysing the status of eco-mobility in selected European countries;
#2. Blog and micro-blog to share ideas and images coming from observation and discussion.

Description of activities

Euro-tour throughout selected cities. The means of transportation include bike, train, public transport, walk… The itinerary runs for ca. 4500 km through different cities in Italy, France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany and Switzerland (the provisional itinerary is annexed).
Meeting and discussion with eco-mobility experts and practitioners. Depending on the availability of the interviewees, discussions might consist of short standard interviews (e.g. what, why, how eco-mobility) and deeper inquiry regarding challenges ad opportunities of eco-mobility solutions (more details on page 3, participants and partners).
Blog and micro-blog reporting the highlights of the tour. All observations and discussions will be regularly recorded and reported online (e.g. nicoladaschio.com/ecomoblog/; @nicdas13; #EcomobilEuropE; Facebook.com/ecomobileurope/)
Analysis of data and final report. A report based on the observations, the interviews and the study of the different realities will be published. The report will include, among other things, data analysis, qualitative case studies, pictures…

64
  days (April 30th to July 3rd)




Budget




1. Bike


Equipment


250 €




Reparations


250 €




Fuel (food!)


1,000 €




2. Train
  tickets


(estimated)


500 €




3.
  Accommodation


 


Couch-surfing / warmshowers.org




Total


2,000 €

story:
My name is Attila Otott Kovacs.  I am a Communication and History graduate, but I've been working most of my life in the hospitality industry (Hotel & Event Management).  Since childhood I have had the opportunity to live and work in different places in the world where I gained much knowledge and experience.  But, I never felt that I belonged any place until I discovered this castle, where I had an idea to do something very unique and special...

...rebuilding this castle will connect history, mystery and adventure with the latest technologies.  It can be an example of how to save ancient structures and use them most practically and effectively.  A living medieval castle adapted to XXI Century needs, where communities are created, people share thoughts, live, eat and sleep.
Your help will achieve a dream that can last for hundreds of years, way beyond our lifetime, and can help many thousands of people rethink their lives, heal and reinforce themselves in the way of the most ancient European culture along the route of pilgrims: The Way of Saint-James, El Camino de Santiago

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to achieve 100,000 € to continue the project and make a real BREAKTHROUGH! With your help we can have all the plans and authorizations for reconstruction.  We can finish the excavation around the castle and reinforce the road that leads to the castle.  It will also help us to produce advertising materials and cover all overhead expenses and allow the continuation of the project for a year.
  • As an initial contributor you will be able to own, in theory, one or several STONES of the castle, engrave your name in history and have your name written on the Calendar of the Castle.  You are not buying a piece of fashion that will end up at the bottom of your drawer very soon...you are contributing to a historical and important renewable energy project. Once rebuilt, you will be welcome to visit this very unique castle as a special STONE owner.

  • If we do not reach our entire goal with this campaign, we will continue to work for this project, simply because I have dedicated my life to this amazing dream. This castle will be rebuilt and I have absolutely no doubt about it!


The Impact


  • This project combines several important things.  Renewable energy usage in a remote place, saving a historically valuable medieval castle and create a particular place where people can heal and spiritually renew themselves in a unique environment never experienced before.

  • There are so many ancient ruins falling apart. There is usually no money for reconstruction. With this project we can make an example of how to save and operate those structures for the benefit of history and communities. I believe that the best way to preserve an ancient domain is by continuing to use it.

  • IMAGINE a medieval castle in the middle of amazing mountains, and rivers, where you will suddenly go back in time.  You will be given a special dress depending on the nature of your visit, and you will be welcomed like nowhere else before. You will be able to explore the fully renewable energy systems hidden beneath stones and wood. You can have a meal from our bio garden and learn how to produce your own vegetables, or just buy some natural seeds. If you are a pilgrim, your feet will be washed at the entrance as a symbol of great respect and purity.  If you come to the retreat, you will be given the best advice how to re-energize yourself. You can hike in the mountains, help in the castle and meet amazing pilgrims with interesting life stories.  Work with horses, relax in perfect silence and breathe the fresh air of the mountains.
  • We have already the full cooperation of the local authorities and we are lobbying for European Cultural funds.  Also, we are in contact with several institutions and distinguished individuals who have promised to support our project.

Risks & Challenges

  • This is the very first step to the full reconstruction of the castle which can reach three million Euros.  (This amount sounds huge at first, but if you consider rebuilding a 1200 year old castle, empowered with the latest renewable energy systems right beside the First European Cultural route (1987), it is not a big amount).  I believe that if united we spread the message, we will be able to find several big donors, foundations and companies who will help us with this amazing challenge.
  • I have been working on this project for more than two years, thinking, planning and creating and spent much of my own resources.  If I will have enough money to eat and pay the overhead fees, I will work until this castle is rebuilt.  This is my life, my dream and my mission.  With perseverance and hard work, I am confident, that I will be able to confront all obstacles and barriers in order to achieve this noble dream.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by talking to your friends, neighbors and relatives about this project.  Join our Facebook page and invite as many people as you can.  You can help us by adding a widget to your blog or website.  You can also send a direct e-mail from indiegogo.  Please feel free to contact us if you have ideas as to how we could reach more people and who could help us to achieve our common goal!Let's reinvent the LEGEND together!

story:
Thank you so much to everyone who has supported both online and offline!! To our new partners, we look forward to working together to create impacting models.

The Idea in a (Shea!) Nutshell!

SBLP Ghana is an energetic young organization helping artisanal farmers in the poorest areas of Ghana to get involved in climate protection initiatives, waste reduction projects, and sustainable businesses. We help farmers and cottage industrialists manage their indigenous resources, put in place green operational processes, and build self-sufficiency.

A Bit About Me and The SBLP Ghana Story

My name is Emmanuel Brace. In 2012, I had the opportunity to join a team of engineering graduate students from MIT in rural Ghana. At that time, I was working on my final graduate project at The Johns Hopkins University.

   

          Team member (Adam-R) and myself with a local chief and his elders

During this trip, I observed that most rural dwellers are disconnected from participation in the global sustainability movement despite the fact that most of their indigenous practices are actually very climate conscious, green and organic. I became determined to increase their visibility.                     

                           

      Traditional  ecologist cultivating vegetables  for a Christmas party  with  the local linguist  i.e. Chief Geldof

             

         Geo-anthropologist posing...and gearing up to teach a (band ) class of 30

Back in the US, I shared my goal with the founder of African Peace Journal (APJ), various hands on research faculty  and innovative pioneers including the leadership of southern Africa based Mezimbite Forest Center(MFC), Sustainable Business Network (SBN),  Komo Learning Centers,  Jump Start Zambia, and  One World Youth Program.

          

                                  Ghana Team Reunion (2012) in Massachusetts

After many discussions, debates, and dialogues - and with superb help from students in MIT’s D-Lab program, a village chief, his community and his elders, and young professionals in rural Ghana - a few projects were initiated. The goal was to explore innovative low cost ways to impact job creation and poverty alleviation in rural communities. For this, we prioritized sustainable economic alternatives that restore the environment and preserve rural lifestyles.

                                                    

Photo Opportunity... with APJ Editor -in -Chief

            

                                                             Volunteers at  MFC

          

       MFC founder having a discussion with the team on the ground at the center

Some of the projects worked on include:

1.  Kom Zibu

2. Waste to Gold

SBLP Ghana  is partnering with SBN to build on the lessons learned from these experiences.

How We Will Operate

SBLP Ghana will design a system to enroll artisans into aggregate units and certify each as a ‘Sustainable Business Leader’ after they complete a standard training process.

         

We will provide these artisans with technical support that is affordable, practical, and feasible.  We will focus on artisans involved in the farming, craft, biomass fuel and mining sectors.

The team - which comprises community members, elders, and local young professionals - and I are very excited about this initiative and believe it’s going to help a lot of people and businesses; from a social, environmental and financial standpoint.

Our First Project

We need your help on our first project! It involves Shea butter, that lovely oil that you find in moisturizers, soaps and shaving creams.

                           

   Melting Shea butter orange and clove soap mixture courtesy of “soapologist”   extraordinaire; Amanda of Swan Maiden

Most body products now contain Shea butter but the reality is that processing Shea butter can be dangerous to the Shea nut harvesters and costly to the environment.

                 

                            60 year old woman smashed to death by Shea tree

                                 Source: Ghana|Joy News|Rafiq Salam

That’s where we come in. We have developed cutting edge methods which use an internationally credible and culturally sensitive approach to address challenges to sustainable operation and supply-chain management. These methods involve applying a tested sustainability assessment, metrics collection and plan development process to achieve results. We will be collaborating with our first group of artisanal farmers - who are also involved in Shea nut processing - at this stage.

We will recognize their organic methods, passed down for generations, and work with them to address challenges which can make their processes less sustainable.

According to the Global Shea Alliance, the industry sources raw material for export from around four million rural women collectors, with a total of approximately 16 million collectors active across the entire Shea zone.

Help Build a Sustainability Revolution in Africa!

Through our modest pilot, in 2013 and 2014, we created direct employment opportunities for six community members and indirect employment for four. These projects were personally funded. At this point, external financing will significantly expand our reach.                                 

                  

Some  Shea processors from  the community which helped us with our first pilot

My team currently needs $5500 in seed funding to keep the ball rolling for this new organization and to fund our first project under the Sustainable Business Leader Program. To get this going, I don’t just want to ask for donations. Rather, I’d like to offer you something tangible, and awesome in the form of perks.

How Indiegogo Works: 

You choose how much you want to pledge and pick a perk (or more...)  At the end of our campaign we pay indiegogo a 4% fee from the money we’ve raised.  If we don't reach our goal, we have to pay 9%.  You can see how important it is that we reach our goal! 

Perks:

Below are some perks up for grabs

                              Sustainable Business Leader Certified Logo

                                             

                                     Digital Photo Pack & Thank You Note

            

                                        Organic Hand Made Shea Souvenir

                               

                                       Photo Credits:Amanda of Swan Maiden

            Your Name in the Credits for the 2015 Global Water Dance-Ghana

                Limited Edition DVD of the 2015 Global Water Dance-Ghana

                                                    Six Years in Mozambique

                                               


                                                               Mind Wanderer

                                         


                                 Africa's Entrepreneurs in the 21st Century

                           

                                         

                                                      A School for My Village

                                               

                                                          The Toaster Project 

                                               

                                          Named Climate  Smart Orchard

                       

There is a great need for environmental education and preservation of open areas for future generations. Therefore, the SBLP  process will support development work on a planned 15 acre sustainable agroforestry research and industrial center.The center will double as a "tinkering" field campus/learning center for science, arts, global studies, and engineering. Your "Named Orchard will be part our innovative pioneering projects. Make history with us! as we empower communities and create awareness for both school children and adults;local and international


Where your Money Will Go:                              

Once the campaign is over, I'll secure all gift items and copies of the books, and have them delivered to you. In the interim, I’ll use the remainder of the money to help launch the organization. The money ( and any extra) will act as seed funding, allowing all the pieces to fall into place for the organization and proper design of the first project. At this point I can attract funding from larger organizations that can help scale it up and eventually become self-sufficient.

The cost breaks down are as follows:        

Stipend for local workers: $500

Start up operational costs and legal obligations : $3000

Travel and Logistics: $1, 500 ( I'm happy to share that a  consulting firm dedicated to serving the food industry through science will be reducing our cost by collaborating with our local agriculture officers. Thank you Dr. Norei!!)

Overhead: $500

Total: $5,500

                                                  

The Impact- Our work has two different kinds of impact. First, our process will prioritize effective resource management methods, livelihood improvement strategies, and a customized and culturally friendly sustainability certification process.

                   

Second, at SBLP Ghana, we believe that knowing each other on a cultural level creates a sense of unity and understanding. Therefore, we use a culturally friendly approach to learn about local business operational processes, and also teach ways to customize and adapt them to globally accepted ones.

We believe that when we know more about and respect each others resources; the world is a safer, peaceful and beautiful place.


The Next Steps-This indiegogo project is only the beginning of what we plan to create. Our goal is to initiate a series of innovative poverty alleviation and sustainable economic alternatives which will harness the conscientiousness of individuals and businesses concerned with ensuring responsible supply chain operations and sourcing from Africa.

Other Ways You Can Help- If you are not able to contribute financially, we appreciate every tweet, every post, and every action that increases awareness. You can use the brilliant indiegogo widgets or just mention it in passing to friends, family, and colleagues.
